data: Invasive procedures include: fistula creation, tistulogram and/or percutaneous transluminal angioplasty, peritoneal dialysis tube insertion, central venous catheter insertion, renal biopsy
Holding antiplatelet therapy is not recommended within 6 weeks of stent placement for bare metal stent, 12 months for drug eluting stent or within 3 months of an acute coronary syndrome

For peritoneal dialysis tube insertion and renal biopsy, HOLD ASA and clopidogrel for 7 days prior to procedure. For all other procedures, aspirin and clopidogrel are NOT to be held prior to procedure
Resource and Guidelines for Perioperative Management of Antithrombotic Therapy
Special Instructions: Continue warfarin up to procedure day, NO bridging required
Special Instructions: Continue warfarin up to 5 days prior to procedure day, bridging required
